product_title: Cicaplast Balm B5+ for Dry Skin Irritations

overall_perception_summary.headline: The Clinical Savior
overall_perception_summary.description: La Roche-Posay Cicaplast is the ultimate 'Fire Extinguisher' for skin. It strips away all vanity and emotion to position itself as a piece of medical equipment—a sterile, precise tool for urgent biological repair. It functions as the unquestioned Medical Authority in the bathroom cabinet, bridging the gap between a pharmaceutical prescription and a daily moisturizer.

foundation.title: The Healing Authority
foundation.description: The brand is anchored purely in the Clinical Lab, acting as The Healer for pathological skin issues rather than aesthetic desires. By prioritizing Safety First (babies, post-radiation) over potency or sensory pleasure, it establishes absolute trust. The strategy is Medical Authority—selling a specialized 'cure' at a democratic price point.

identity.title: The Sterile Sage
identity.description: The distance between brand and user is significant; this is The Reliable Expert speaking to a patient, not a friend. Dominated by The Sage archetype (60%), it relies on data, patents ('Tribioma'), and sterility to project competence. The Visual Identity is Pharma-Code—white, blue, and grid-aligned—signaling that this product belongs in a hospital, not a spa.

communication.title: Molecular Education
communication.description: The messaging is that of The Chemist, hooking the user with molecule names ('Vitamin B5', 'Madecassoside') rather than poetic benefits. The USP is The Specialist, claiming ownership over 'Skin Recovery' for specific medical conditions. The narrative is a Lab Breakthrough, using Science Education to prove efficacy through diagrams and dermatologist endorsements.

benefits.title: Biological Relief
benefits.description: Functionally, it offers Restoration, fixing broken barriers and soothing irritation rather than enhancing beauty. The payoff is Relief/Safety—the absence of pain and the assurance of tolerance. Socially, it is The Safe Choice, allowing the user to signal they are a Pragmatist who trusts science over hype.

marker_1.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] ORIGIN OF AUTHORITY (The Source of Power)
marker_1.reasoning: The authority is derived entirely from the laboratory context—'Laboratoire Dermatologique', 'Proprietary prebiotic complex', and 'Tribioma' signal that power comes from synthetic molecular engineering (Origin: 5/5 Pure Clinical). The mission is explicitly to fix pathology rather than enhance beauty—'Soothes rough, dry, and irritated skin', 'Post-procedure', and usage for 'Chemotherapy' patients position this as a medical intervention (Mission: 1/5 Pathology Cure). Clinical source + medical fix = The Healer.
marker_1.evidence: Laboratoire Dermatologique... Proprietary prebiotic complex... Soothes rough, dry, and irritated skin... Used post-procedure, including chemotherapy and radiation

marker_2.reasoning: The scope is laser-focused on micro-correction—treating 'irritated areas' on the face, hands, and body, rather than promising global lifestyle changes (Scope: 1/5 Micro-Correction). However, with widespread availability and a mass-market price point (~$16-18), it refuses to gatekeep this medical-grade performance (Access: 5/5 Democratic). High accessibility + specific medical focus = The Democratizers of skin repair.
marker_2.evidence: On irritated areas... face, body, hands, and lips... Suitable for babies 1 week and up... Unlock 10% Off Your Order

marker_3.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Spec Sheet (Exact percentages, pH, sourcing)
marker_3.reasoning: Safety is the absolute non-negotiable. The claim 'Suitable for babies 1 week and up' is the ultimate tolerance stress test, proving they sacrifice aggressive potency for absolute safety (Performance: 1/5 Hypoallergenic). The information density relies on listing specific complexes like 'Tribioma', 'Vitamin B5', and 'Madecassoside', treating the customer like a clinician reading a chart (Transparency: 1/5 Spec Sheet). Extreme safety + technical disclosure = Safety First.
marker_3.evidence: Suitable for babies 1 week and up... Accepted by the National Eczema Association... Formulated with Tribioma... Non-greasy, non-comedogenic

marker_4.reasoning: The aesthetic is aggressively sterile—white tube, sans-serif Helvetica fonts, and zero decorative elements signal a medical tool, not a beauty product (Aesthetic: 1/5 Clinical Sterile). The price point fits the 'French Pharmacy' niche—accessible but commanded a slight premium over basic lotions, sitting firmly in Masstige (Value: 3/5 Masstige). Sterile look + accessible premium price = The Medical Authority.
marker_4.evidence: Medical-laboratory aesthetic... Stark white bottles... Helvetica-like sans-serif... Cyan-blue square logo... 10% Off

marker_5.reasoning: The brand emits zero emotional heat. There are no 'love' claims or exclamation points; it is 'Accepted,' 'Formulated,' and 'Recommended' (Thermostat: 1/5 Robotic). The power dynamic is top-down; they are the 'Laboratoire,' and you are the patient. They hold the knowledge ('Tribioma'), and you apply it as directed (Power Dynamic: 5/5 The Deity). Cold emotion + absolute authority = The Reliable Expert.
marker_5.evidence: Laboratoire Dermatologique... Accepted by the National Eczema Association... Recommended for post-procedure... Damaged formula

marker_6.reasoning: The brand is primarily The Sage (60%), driven by the pursuit of truth through science—'Laboratoire,' 'Tribioma,' and 'Dermatologist recommended' are Sage codes. The product function is The Caregiver (30%), dedicated to healing 'cracked, dry, irritated skin' and protecting babies. A hint of The Ruler (10%) appears in the rigid 'How To' protocols and authority badges. Sage + Caregiver = The Seekers, finding the truth to help the user.
marker_6.evidence: Laboratoire Dermatologique... Tribioma... Soothes rough skin... Suitable for babies... Eczema Seal

marker_7.reasoning: The tone is grave and academic. Words like 'Post-procedure,' 'Radiation,' and 'Tribioma' are serious medical terms (Humor: 1/5 Grave, Formality: 1/5 Academic). There is zero enthusiasm; the facts are presented as clinical data points (Enthusiasm: 1/5 Clinical). This creates a voice that sounds like a diagnosis, designed to build trust through distance and precision.
marker_7.evidence: Used post-procedure... chemotherapy and radiation... Proprietary prebiotic complex... Tribioma... Damaged formula

marker_8.reasoning: The visual temperature is hospital-grade sterile, dominated by stark white and clinical cyan blue (Thermostat: 1/5 Sterile). The layout is a rigid Swiss Grid with Helvetica-like typography, emphasizing order and control with no room for playful chaos (Entropy: 1/5 Swiss Grid). White/Blue + Rigid Grid = Pharma-Code, signaling absolute medical safety.
marker_8.evidence: Stark white bottles... Cyan-blue square logo... Helvetica-like sans-serif... Rigid sans-serif alignments... Low-saturation grayscale palette
marker_8.look_and_feel: A medical-laboratory aesthetic rendered human through soft grays and cool blues, establishing cleanliness and credibility.
marker_8.distinctive_asset_1: Cyan-blue square logo paired with all-caps sans-serif typography
marker_8.distinctive_asset_2: Vertical product name running up the tube's left side in contrasting black
marker_8.distinctive_asset_3: High-contrast drop shadows and minimal gradient crema for depth
marker_8.distinctive_asset_4: Graphic: Instructional iconography such as clocks and body silhouettes
marker_8.distinctive_asset_5: Typography style: Tight tracking, Helvetica-like sans-serif, capitalized headings
marker_8.primary_palette: They lean completely into clinical authority — stark white bottles and Helvetica-like fonts that feel plucked from a pharmacy shelf.

marker_9.reasoning: The hook is the chemical composition: 'Cicaplast,' 'B5,' and 'Tribioma' are the subjects of the messaging, assuming the user speaks the language of the lab (Hook: 1/5 Molecule). The persuasion is pure rational data—citing dermatologist recommendations, eczema acceptance, and post-procedure protocols (Persuasion: 1/5 Raw Data). Sells the noun + uses data logic = The Chemist.
marker_9.evidence: Cicaplast Balm B5+... Formulated with Tribioma... Vitamin B5... Madecassoside... Accepted by the National Eczema Association

marker_10.reasoning: There is no founder story. The hero is the 'Laboratoire Dermatologique'—a collective of faceless experts and dermatologists (Protagonist: 1/5 Nobel). The setting is the sterile lab environment implied by the packaging and the 'post-procedure' context (Setting: 1/5 Sterile). This is a story of research and patents, not personal struggle.
marker_10.evidence: Laboratoire Dermatologique... Dermatologist-recommended ingredients... Used post-procedure... radiation treatment

marker_11.reasoning: The primary validator is the Board—'Accepted by National Eczema Association' and 'Dermatologist Recommended' are the strongest trust signals (Validator: 1/5 The Board). The proof is clinical suitability for extreme cases like radiation and newborns, relying on safety data rather than 'glow' or 'feel' (Proof: 1/5 The Graph). Expert validation + clinical proof = Derm-Validation.
marker_11.evidence: Accepted by the National Eczema Association... Dermatologist-recommended ingredients... Safe for use on babies from one week old

marker_12.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] THE OWNERSHIP OBJECT (What You Claim to Own)
marker_12.slider_a_position_name: ▼ The Tech (How it works: Encapsulation, Time-Release)
marker_12.slider_b_label: [SLIDER] THE TARGET SCOPE (How Wide Is The Net?)
marker_12.reasoning: The brand claims ownership of the technology 'Tribioma' and the 'Cicaplast' concept (Ownership: 4/5 Tech). The scope is hyper-specific to 'damaged formula,' 'irritations,' and 'post-procedure' use. It is not a general lotion; it is a specialist tool for a specific condition (Scope: 5/5 Condition). Tech ownership + Niche condition = The Specialist.
marker_12.evidence: Proprietary prebiotic complex (Tribioma™)... Post-procedure use... Damaged formula... Cracked, dry, irritated skin

marker_13.reasoning: The content focus is on explaining the 'When' and 'Where' with icons and breaking down the 'Tribioma' complex (Depth: 2/5 Explainer). The intent is to prove safety and efficacy for medical-grade issues like eczema and radiation burns, rather than pushing a hard commercial sell (Intent: 1/5 The Thesis). Explaining mechanism + proving thesis = Science Education.
marker_13.evidence: Icon 1 – Clock Symbol... Icon 2 – Body Symbol... Formulated with Tribioma... Accepted by National Eczema Association

marker_14.reasoning: The action mechanism is purely healing—'Soothes rough, dry, and irritated skin' and 'Protects against drying effects' (Action: 4/5 Healer). The outcome is biological restoration of the skin barrier and microbiome, not visual perfection. It fixes the damage; it doesn't apply a filter (Outcome: 1/5 Biological). Healing mechanism + biological goal = Restoration.
marker_14.evidence: Soothes rough, dry, and irritated skin... Protects against drying effects... Damaged formula... Tribioma (microbiome reference)

marker_15.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Panic Mode (Urgent need to stop pain/itch)
marker_15.slider_b_position_name: ▼ Sanctuary (I feel safe inside my own body)
marker_15.reasoning: The product addresses 'Panic Mode' situations—cracked skin, radiation burns, baby eczema. It resolves an urgent negative state (Anxiety: 1/5 Panic Mode). The result is Sanctuary—the feeling of safety and returning to a baseline where your body doesn't hurt (Self-Perception: 1/5 Sanctuary). Urgent relief + internal safety = Relief/Safety.
marker_15.evidence: Soothes rough, dry, and irritated skin... Safe for use on babies... Post-procedure... Radiation treatment

marker_16.slider_a_position_name: ▼ The Tool (I buy it only because it functions)
marker_16.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Standard (What everyone uses; the default)
marker_16.reasoning: Purchase motivation is pure utility. You don't buy Cicaplast to express your personality; you buy it because your skin is broken, and this is the tool to fix it (Signal: 1/5 The Tool). It is a standard, widely recognized solution ('French Pharmacy' staple), positioning the user as a rational pragmatist who chooses function over form (Tribal: 1/5 The Standard). Utility + Standard = The Pragmatist.
marker_16.evidence: Multi-purpose soothing balm... Safe for use on babies... Accepted by National Eczema Association... 40ml / 100ml

marker_17.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Normalization (I want to look like everyone else)
marker_17.reasoning: The social goal is normalization—returning damaged, irritated skin to a 'normal' state so the user can blend in (Social Vector: 1/5 Normalization). The group dynamic is The Majority/Safe Choice—relying on the consensus of doctors and the Eczema Association to ensure this is the correct, risk-free purchase (Group Dynamic: 1/5 The Majority). Normalization + Consensus = The Safe Choice.
marker_17.evidence: Accepted by the National Eczema Association... Dermatologist recommended... Safe for babies
